meanings.sent1: The wall made of brickier material was stronger than the one made of wood.
meanings.sent2: The new house was brickier than the old one, making it more durable.
meanings.sent3: I tried to build a brickier sandcastle at the beach, but it kept crumbling.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded brickier than usual, as if she had a sore throat.
meanings.sent5: The brickier texture of the fabric made it ideal for colder weather.

meanings.sent1: The dense cake was brickier than the fluffy one.
meanings.sent2: His stubborn attitude made him seem even brickier than usual.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur felt surprisingly brickier after the bath.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was so thick, it felt brickier than the walls.
meanings.sent5: The brickier appearance of the sculpture gave it a solid, timeless feel.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a brick.
meanings.sent1: The heavy backpack felt even brickier under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: The soup had a brickier consistency after adding more vegetables.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were as brickier as a wall, always falling flat.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere in the room became brickier as tension filled the air.
meanings.sent5: The brickier nature of the task made it challenging but rewarding.
